channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped helium cannisters, 13th January
item.description:
I don’t know why helium users can’t clean up after themselves! These gave obviously been dumped where used. Public health risk?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grierson Road, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle parked for over two months on residential street, 13th January
item.description:
The vehicle has been parked on this street for over two months. It was originally parked outside two neighbouring houses and about one month ago it was moved and has remained parked directly outside my house since then without moving. The vehicle appears unused and has been left in the same position for a prolonged period. It occupies all of the available space outside my property, making it difficult to park on the street. On several occasions I have had to park a considerable distance away due to lack of available parking. I believe the vehicle may be abandoned and would appreciate it being inspected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road North, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electrics recycling overflowing and all over pavement, 13th January
item.description:
Obviously people have brought their broken electrical post Christmas and bin is full up sad I people have left next to it and now strewn all over pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Honor Oak, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Dumped bin, 13th January
item.description:
Someone has dumped a bin here it has been here for weeks now and people are filling it with rubbish. It has just been dumped here can it be removed as causing rats issue . Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goddington, Greater London

item.title: Light not working and fuse switch keeps tripping in TITMUSS AVENUE numbers 1-14 entrance, 13th January
item.description:
Please could the ground floor entrance lobby light be replaced as it is currently not working and the fuse switch keeps tripping believed to be caused by leaking water into the light itself. The address is... 1-14 entrance titmuss avenue Thamesmead London SE28 Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lytton Strachey Path, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin, lamp post,bus stop sign and shelter blocking footpath, 13th January
item.description:
This narrow section of footpath is very difficult to navigate due to the placement of the bin and the lamp post in tandem with the bus stop sign and shelter. Please could the bin at least be moved to beside the bus shelter. The bus stop sign should also be moved to right beside the lamp post.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sweep required, 13th January
item.description:
Garbage all over the roads and gutters from the corner shop. Street hasn’t been swept in months. Needs attention. A public bin needs to be placed on the corner near Londis to avoid this

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rainton Road, Charlton

item.title: Rubbish and urine on communal staircase leading to apartments, 13th January
item.description:
The communal areas have not been cleaned since last week and are in a horrible condition. This is an ongoing problem, communal areas seems to get cleaned only when a resident makes a complain despite cleaning being due biweekly as specified in service charges

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous pothole, 13th January
item.description:
The pothole was filled a few days ago when I first reported and I am grateful it was done so quick. However, the filling start to sink on the very first day and now pothole is as bad as it was when I first reported it. It is very dangerous especially at low visibility times. Please address this ASAP. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79--87, Avenue Road, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Museum of Comedy, 13th January
item.description:
There is a pothole on the road, approximately one metre from passing buses. The hole collects rainwater, and when buses pass, the water splashes onto pedestrians using the footpath. This creates a nuisance and is in very poor condition, requiring urgent attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Bloomsbury Way, Bloomsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin blocking narrow section of pavement, 13th January
item.description:
The council bin has been placed on the narrowest section of the pavement which is causing an obstruction and making it so people often walk in the road. Please can it be placed on the north side of the bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305A, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
